fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: I have gained many face to face followers who are interested in cryptocurrency. Although most of them are interested in profits, but I will write daily knowledge to help them understand at least what they are investing in starting today.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Bitcoin (BTC) is the first digital currency which is not controlled by any entity but managed to remain in concensus created by Satoshi Nakamoto in 2008. The core technology is blockchain and further concepts are open, transparent, borderless, decentralized, unconfiscatible, pseudoanonymous and fixed supply of 21 Million BTC. All other cryptocurrencies follows these properties with some twists and turns. Ofcourse there are nagative aspects in reality.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Ethereum (ETH) is the first cryptocurrency with the innovation of decentralized finance (DeFi). Imagine anyone regardless of age, race, and background can participate in finance such as trading, investing, earning interest through deposit and other methods, lending & borrowing, and subscriptions without needing permission and cannot be stopped. No need for registration, verification, etc, just a press of few buttons. The demand pressure is because all services in this ecosystem uses ETH as the fee.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Bitcoin Cash (BCH) was born due to the different opinions between Bitcoin developers. The dispute was that the block size of Bitcoin was too small which causes slow transactions where simply the solution was increasing the block size. However, changing the properties of Bitcoin is against the concept of Bitcoin should not be directed by anyone. Therefore, the solution was to create another Bitcoin fork or a new coin which shows the beauty of cryptocurrency where anyone can start their own.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: After the split between Bitcoin and Bitcoin Cash where Bitcoin focuses on store of value while Bitcoin Cash focuses on efficient transaction, another dispute happened between Bitcoin Cash developers. One faction supports Roger Ver and Jihan Wu that maintains the Bitcoin Cash blocksize to 32 MB. The other faction supports Craig Steven Wright whom they believed to be the Satoshi Nakamoto whose claim is rejected by majority of the world and Calvin Ayre forking Bitcoin Cash into Bitcoin Satoshi Vision (SV) where the project believes to correct the Bitcoin protocol based on the vision of Satoshi Nakamoto with a blocksize of 128 MB.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: A year after the split between Bitcoin Cash and Bitcoin SV, comes another split in Bitcoin Cash. A faction proposed an 8% tax on miners for development purposes but many disagree. Thus they split from Bitcoin Cash to Bitcoin Cash ABC (BCHA).

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Litecoin was created by Charlie Lee in October 2011 as a spinoff of Bitcoin, and is considered as one of the early alternative cryptocurrencies (altcoins). Litecoin aims to be the “Silver to Bitcoin’s Gold” by taking on the best innovations of Bitcoin with a more lightweight approach to achieving Bitcoin’s noble goals. While Litecoin was created by cloning Bitcoin’s codebase, there are several key differences: (1) Block time, the Litecoin Network targets a block time of 2.5 minutes, while the Bitcoin network targets a block time of 10 minutes. This means that transactions can confirm faster compared to Bitcoin, and the network has a higher throughput. (2) Maximum supply, the Litecoin protocol states that there can be a maximum of 84 million Litecoin, while Bitcoin has a maximum supply of 21 million Bitcoin. (3) Proof-of-Work Algorithm, Litecoin uses a different proof-of-work algorithm called Scrypt, while Bitcoin uses the SHA-256 algorithm. Scrypt is a memory-hard algorithm which was initially created to be ASIC-resistant. (4) Address, Litecoin addresses start with either “L” for legacy, non-Segwit addresses or “M” for Segwit-enabled addresses. Bitcoin addresses start with either “1”, “3” or “bc1”.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: XRP is a distributed ledger created by Ripple Foundation to connect banks, payment providers and digital asset exchanges, enabling real-time settlement expeditions and lower transaction fees. The Ripple foundation itself is well known for their efforts in building cooperations with authorities and banking entities which is the reason for its rise into one of the top cryptocurrencies. On the other side, they are disliked by some of the cryptocurrency communities especially from advocates of decentralization because the algorithm they used is the Ripple Consensus Protocol Algorithm (RCPA) where it is based on privately trusted nodes which makes some people suspicious that XRP is centrally controlled by Ripple.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Paxos Gold (PAXG) is tokenized gold in cryptocurrency ~ 1 ounce of gold which can be physically claimed at Paxos Trust Company, LLC. Investing in PAXG is almost the same as investing in gold. At the beginning of COVID-19 Pandemic I can no longer find physical gold which is why I decided to buy PAXG instead.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: United States Dollar Tether (USDT) is the first cryptocurrency pegged to the United States Dollar (USD) where 1 USDT ~ 1 USD. USDT is backed by USD where we can issue 1 USDT by depositing 1 USD to Tether Limited or vice versa claim 1 USD with 1 USDT. Many also called USDT a stable coin to the USD where it is useful to quickly and efficiently trade back and forth between cryptocurrency coins and USD. For example, it will be too late to sell when the market crashes because it takes too long to deposit to an exchange and usually the exchange breaks down during panic selling time. However with USDT, we can sell almost instantly and even vice versa. Investing in USDT is the same as investing in USD.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Monero (XMR) is currently the most popular privacy cryptocurrency coin. Bitcoin is pseudoanonymous where if the identity of the Bitcoin users is known, all that users transactions becomes transparent. Monero is anonymous making every transaction private based on the CryptoNote protocol with the privacy technology are RingCT, Stealth Addresses, Ring Signatures, Transactions over Tor/I2P, Dandelion++. In the world of increasing transparency, some users just needs privacy. However, this coin is highly disfavored by governments and higher authorities because it goes against their agenda of monitoring everything.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Like USDT, IDK is Indonesian Rupiah (IDR) on the block chain where we can issue 1 IDK by depositing 1000 IDR to IDK Foundation and vice versa claim 1000 IDR for 1 IDK. Currently IDK is used in XTokenomy contract platform for derivative or future trading Bitcoin (BTC) (trading using forex method with longs and shorts). In the future, IDK will be used for cross border transactions and decentralized finance. Investing in IDK is the same as investing in IDR.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: USD Coin (USDC) is also a stable coin pegged to the USD managed by Centre but unlike USDT it did not have any problems with the authorities and always open for audits. USDC is more trusted but the problem before 2020 is its low supply below 5 Billions where billionaires who wants to trade their coins to USDC cannot get enough. Even back then when I want to sell my coins to USDC, I got an expensive price because the lack of liquidity. However today there are 21 Billions in circulation.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Like USDT, DAI is designed to be $1, but unlike USDT it is not maintained by a single institution and not backed by actual dollars but maintained its price through algorithm created by Maker DAO. Simply when the price is above $1, the algorithm encourages users to mint more DAI increasing the supply thus decreasing the price, and when the price is below $1, the algorithm encourages users to burn more DAI decreasing the supply thus increasing the price. The advantage of this algorithmic stable coin is that it is decentralized, cannot be censored, and cannot be confiscated. The disadvantage sometimes the algorithm fails to keep the price at $1 but just wait and it will recover.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Ethereum Classic (ETC) is the original Ethereum blockchain maintaining its history. In 2016, Ethereum was hacked with the hacker stealing the funds. The currenty Ethereum (ETH) through decentralized decision decided to renew the blockchain history as if the hack never happened where the funds are preserved. The original blockchain history is renamed with 'classic'. The supporter of ETC believes that code is absolute. If a hack happens that it happens not altering the history based on decentralized decision.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Almost the same as USDC, STASIS EURO (EURS) is a stable coin pegged to the EURO transparently backed by EURO reserves at STASIS Foundation. Those who prefers to hold EURO rather than USD holds EURS rather than USDC. Investing in EURS is almost the same as investing in EURO foreign currency issued by the European Union. For now EURS is still young that has a much lower circulating supply compared to USDT and USDC of 32 Millions.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: DOGE is currently known as a meme coin because of its fun Shiba Inu Logo. In 2021, it was promoted by Elon Musk, Snoop Dog, Gene Simons, and Dallas Mavericks. The year before DOGE was trending in Tiktok because of a movement trying to make DOGE reach $1. Originally in 2013, Billy Markus and Jackson Palmer forked Litecoin and Luckycoin into DOGE as a joke to the payment system and the wild speculations of cryptocurrency at the time. It then evolves into a fun and friendly internet currency with a fun community which is mainly used for tipping in Reddit and Twitter.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Binance is currently the most popular cryptocurrency exchange in the world. It released two coins, Binance Coin (BNB) and Binance Smart Chain (BSC). In 2017, BNB was released as a utility coin to get discounts, VIP, and other promos at Binance Exchange. It is also similar to dividends as there are annual burns to increase the price of the coin using some of the company's profit thus holding BNB is like receiving some of the profits of the company. In 2021, BSC was released as the next popular alternative to Ethereum (ETH) where users can enjoy decentralized finance (DeFi) with much cheaper fees but there are rumors that it is less decentralized.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Before Binance Smart Chain (BSC), there was already Tron (TRX) already following Ethereum's path into decentralized finance (DeFi). Like in Ethereum (ETH) and BSC, there are automated market maker (AMM) decentralized exchange (DEX) with yield farming, non-fungible tokens (NFT), subscription models, and other automated and decentralized banking services. A notable difference is that TRX does not use transaction fee system but bandwidth system which is why transactions are much cheaper.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: While there was already Tron (TRX) before Binance Smart Chain (BSC), decentralized finance (DeFi) in Tron is its own ecosystem back then. At the time, another alternative already existed and that is Tomo Chain (TOMO) which is also Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) compatible which means that source codes in Ethereum Solidity can also work in Tomo Chain ecosystem. Like Tron and Binance Smart Chain, Tomo Chain provides larger scalability that allows faster and cheaper transactions in addition to its Proof-of-stake Voting (PosV) consensus algorithm. Another feature that differentiates TOMO with the rest of the DeFi ecosystem is that TOMO provides privacy enabled transaction.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: In 2014 Shanghai-based blockchain R&D company OnChain developed NEO which back then was known to be the Ethereum of China. The early website described NEO as Smart Economy = Digital Assets + Digital Identity + Smart Contract. Digital Assets allows tokenization of financial assets, Smart Contract allows programming of finance, and Digital Identity can give them legality by providing digital certificates on the blockchain. NEO continues to evolve since then such as providing cross chain interoperability and on chain governance, and their network expands around the glove not only in China.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Zilliqa started its road to be the first smart contract platform to implement Sharding protocol in 2017 which is a method for processing transactions in parallel. It is one of the ways to increase scalability, meaning providing faster and cheaper transactions. It successfully launched in 2019 and entered the decentralized finance (DeFi) space in early 2021 alongside other Ethereum alternative DeFi chains.

fajar_quotes.author: Fajar Purnama
fajar_quotes.quote: Solana is also able to run smart contracts in parallel and one of the fastest smart contract platform there is where during its live main net in early 2020, it was able to run 50 thousands smart contracts per second. There are 8 key innovations that made Solana possible: Proof of History (POH), Tower BFT, Turbine, Gulf Stream, Sealevel, Pipelining, Cloudbreak, Archivers. In early 2021, third party developers built decentralized finance  (DeFi) applications on Solana.
